We confirmed and extended previous data [ 20 ] to show that ligand - activated <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> as well as <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> uses importin-alpha for its nuclear import ( Figure 2A and 2B ) .

text: This interaction between <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and importin-alpha was significant at concentrations as low as 10-12 M and was maximal with 10-8 M FP .
Subsequent <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> nuclear translocation was rapid and sustained at significant levels for at least 14 h ( Figure 2B ) .

Using IP-Western blotting we showed that FP at 10-12-10-8 M decreased the association between <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and importin-alpha induced by anti-CD3 / CD28 stimulation in a concentration - dependent manner ( Figure 2C ) .

text: In addition , using <extra_id_0> GFP-labelled GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and confocal microscopy we demonstrated that <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> nuclear import following anti-CD3 / CD28 stimulation for 30 min was attenuated by pretreatment with FP ( 10-8 M ) ( Figure 2D ) .
